alert.note: Alert for Imperial (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Dust Advisory issued May 01 at 6:43PM PDT until May 01 at 8:45PM PDT by NWS Phoenix
info.description: The National Weather Service in Phoenix has issued a * Dust Advisory for... Northwestern Imperial County in southeastern California... * Until 845 PM PDT. * At 643 PM PDT, a dust channel was being generated over the Lower Borrego Valley and Ocotillo Wells area, and is nearly stationary with dust spreading eastward through the northern Imperial Valley. HAZARD...Less than one half mile visibility with strong wind in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Doppler radar. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. * This includes the following highways... CA Route 78 between mile markers 1 and 30. CA Route 111 between mile markers 20 and 48. CA Route 86 between mile markers 17 and 51. Locations impacted include... Brawley, Westmorland, Ocotillo Wells, Fish Creek Wash, Calipatria, Slab City, Niland, Alamorio and Wiest. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake. Motorists should not drive into an area of blowing dust. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE!
